author: Staff Reporter
text:
Volunteers removing nails and advertisement boards from trees in R.S. Puram in the city on Sunday.-Photo: S. Siva Saravanan

As drum beats filled the air on a pleasant Sunday morning, citizens of Coimbatore gathered on D.B. Road with nail pullers and pliers. ‘Jollya Clean Pannalaam Vaanga’, an initiative to free the trees in the area of the numerous advertisement boards nailed on them, was the agenda.

“This initiative is part of Swachh Bharat cleaning efforts,” said CGS Manion, one of the 30 Swachh Bharat Ambassadors for Coimbatore.

Though such efforts have been taken in the past, boards are still being nailed. “Awareness has to be created so that different residents’ associations can take it up and carry it forward in their areas,” he added.

“Each of us has a responsibility to make sure that the boards are taken down. People need to understand that lives are entrapped under these trees,” said Vanitha Mohan, managing trustee of the NGO Siruthuli.

K. Vijayakarthikeyan, Commissioner, Coimbatore Corporation, urged the residents to take up the initiative. “The citizens need to take up this effort and make sure that this is not an one-time affair, but a practice for the years to come.”

The initiative heads to Valangulam on February 13 and then proceeds to Saibaba Colony, Vadavalli, and a few other areas.

To join the cause, the Swacch Bharat Ambassadors can be contacted at 95009-59090 and 96777-00081.
title: Trees freed of nails, advertisements
